questions.question: ....................................... I like him I don't want to spend every evening with him.
questions.description: We use although to connect two contrasting ideas. It is a subordinating conjunction and usually goes at the beginning of the clause.

questions.question: She liked him ......................................... she did not want to marry him.
questions.description: But is a coordinating conjunction. It has more or less the same meaning as although but it is used to connect two clauses of equal rank.
